Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery grooved vessel, the interior is covered with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, which has flaked away in a number of places, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of three lines of red-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394624) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394624)
